title: Drop party

properties.value: Drop parties are events in which players drop items for fun, and other players try to pick them up first. While drop parties were traditionally held in the Falador Party Room, they can now be held anywhere in Gielinor on any world.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Drop partyThe RuneScape Classic Wiki also has an article on: classicrsw:Drop party
"Dp" redirects here. For other uses, see Death Plateau.

Drop parties are events in which players drop items for fun, and other players try to pick them up first. While drop parties were traditionally held in the Falador Party Room, they can now be held anywhere in Gielinor on any world.

Drop parties are often advertised in the events section of the RuneScape Forums on the RuneScape website or at the Grand Exchange. Some scammers falsely advertise drop parties in order to obtain donations from other players to drop, or lure unsuspecting players into dangerous locations like the Wilderness, but many drop parties are legitimate. Drops at drop parties may range from junk, like tin ore, to extremely valuable items, such as dragon, Barrows items, and godswords.

Contents

  • 1 Types of drop parties
    • 1.1 Traditional drop parties
    • 1.2 Falador Party Room
  • 2 Communities

Types of drop parties[edit | edit source]

There are two types of drop parties:

Traditional drop parties[edit | edit source]

Players would manually drop items on the floor. The host would have to run to a bank to retrieve items after dropping their inventory. It is a common practice to use Telekinetic Grab at such parties, even though this is often frowned upon. It is also quite common for players to set up box traps on predicted item spawning spots. This makes it more difficult for other players to retrieve the dropped items, and is also frowned upon and seen as "trolling."

Falador Party Room[edit | edit source]

Main article: Falador Party Room

In the Party Room, different players can put items into the chest, and they will be released at the same time. Before the balloons were implemented, it was impossible to cast Telekinetic Grab inside the room.

Communities[edit | edit source]

There are many drop party communities that often host large, legitimate drop parties for other players. The goal of these communities is to spread wealth to lower level players so they can level up and afford better gear. By hosting drop parties, communities like this hope to promote generosity and build a fun community around the Party Room.
rawContent:
{{External|rs|rsc}}
{{redirect3|Dp|For other uses, see [[Death Plateau]]}}
'''Drop parties''' are events in which players drop items for fun, and other players try to pick them up first. While drop parties were traditionally held in the [[Falador]] [[Party Room]], they can now be held anywhere in [[Gielinor]] on any world.

Drop parties are often advertised in the events section of the [[RuneScape Forums]] on the ''[[RuneScape]]'' website or at the [[Grand Exchange]]. Some [[scamming|scammers]] falsely advertise drop parties in order to obtain donations from other players to drop, or [[lure]] unsuspecting players into dangerous locations like the [[Wilderness]], but many drop parties are legitimate. Drops at drop parties may range from junk, like [[tin ore]], to extremely valuable items, such as [[Dragon equipment|dragon]], [[Barrows equipment|Barrows items]], and [[godsword]]s.

==Types of drop parties==
There are two types of drop parties:

===Traditional drop parties===
Players would manually drop items on the floor. The host would have to run to a bank to retrieve items after dropping their inventory. It is a common practice to use [[Telekinetic Grab]] at such parties, even though this is often frowned upon. It is also quite common for players to set up [[box trap]]s on predicted item spawning spots. This makes it more difficult for other players to retrieve the dropped items, and is also frowned upon and seen as "trolling."

===Falador Party Room===
{{main|Falador Party Room}}
In the [[Party Room]], different players can put items into the chest, and they will be released at the same time. Before the balloons were implemented, it was impossible to cast Telekinetic Grab inside the room.

== Communities ==
There are many drop party communities that often host large, legitimate drop parties for other players. The goal of these communities is to spread [[Coins|wealth]] to lower level players so they can level up and afford better gear. By hosting drop parties, communities like this hope to promote generosity and build a fun community around the [[Falador Party Room|Party Room]]. 
[[Category:Culture]]
